content.title: IMMEDIATE ACTION
steps: Pull over to safest spot possible (hard shoulder if motorway)
If on motorway: exit vehicle from left, stand behind barrier
If on road: stay in car with seatbelt on (safer than standing in road)
Call breakdown service (AA, RAC, Green Flag) or emergency fuel delivery
DO NOT walk to petrol station carrying a fuel can (illegal on motorway, dangerous)

content.text: Who to Call (In Order)
1. Your Breakdown Cover (If You Have It) â€” FREE

content.text: They'll bring 5-10 litres of fuel FREE (enough to reach petrol station). Response time: 30 mins-2 hours depending on location.

If no breakdown cover, search 'emergency fuel delivery near me' or call a local service.
**Cost:** Â£50-Â£120 (fuel at pump price + Â£20-Â£60 delivery fee)
**Response time:** 30 mins-2 hours (urban areas faster)
3. Friend/Family with Fuel Can
If someone can bring you fuel:

items: **Metal jerry can** (Â£20-Â£40) â€” Plastic cans illegal for petrol
**5-10 litres** â€” Enough to reach station
**Fill at petrol station** â€” Explain it's for breakdown
**Cost:** Just fuel (Â£7-Â£15 for 5-10 litres)

content.text: âš ï¸ Plastic containers for petrol are ILLEGAL in UK. Must use approved metal jerry can. Petrol stations will refuse to fill plastic bottles.
Petrol vs Diesel: Different Problems
Petrol Car (Easier to Fix)
**What happens:** Engine stutters, loses power, stops.

items: Add 5-10 litres fuel
Turn ignition to 'on' position (don't start) for 30 seconds (primes fuel pump)
Try starting â€” may take 5-10 attempts
Once started, drive to nearest petrol station immediately

content.text: **Damage risk:** LOW â€” Modern petrol cars rarely damaged by running dry
Diesel Car (More Problematic)
**What happens:** Engine shudders, white smoke, cuts out.

items: Add 10+ litres diesel (more than petrol cars need)
May need to 'bleed' fuel system (let air out)
Turn ignition on for 30 secs, off, repeat 3-4 times
Try starting â€” may take 10-20 attempts
If won't start after 20 tries: need mechanic to bleed system (Â£80-Â£150)

content.text: **Damage risk:** MEDIUM â€” Air in fuel system can damage fuel pump/injectors if severe
âš ï¸ Diesel cars: DO NOT crank engine repeatedly if it won't start. You'll damage fuel pump (Â£400-Â£1,200 repair). After 10-15 tries, call mechanic to bleed system.
Misfuelling (Put Wrong Fuel In)
Put Petrol in Diesel Car (COMMON + SERIOUS)
**DO NOT START THE ENGINE**

items: Petrol damages diesel fuel pump immediately (Â£1,500-Â£3,000 repair)
If you haven't started it: drain tank (Â£200-Â£300), no damage
If you've started/driven it: full system flush + pump replacement (Â£1,500-Â£5,000)

content.text: **Action:** Call breakdown service IMMEDIATELY. Do NOT start car.
Put Diesel in Petrol Car (LESS SERIOUS)
**Less damaging but still don't start it**

items: Diesel won't ignite in petrol engine (car won't run properly)
Drain tank (Â£150-Â£250)
Usually no permanent damage if caught before starting

content.text: **Misfuel drain cost:** Â£200-Â£400 on-site, Â£150-Â£300 at garage

Why Running on Empty Is Bad (Beyond Breaking Down)

items: **Fuel pump damage:** Fuel cools/lubricates pump. Running dry overheats it (Â£200-Â£600 replacement)
**Sediment in tank:** Bottom of tank has debris. Gets sucked into fuel filter when low (Â£40-Â£80 filter replacement)
**Diesel injector damage:** Modern diesels very sensitive to air in system (Â£400-Â£1,200 per injector)
**Stress on engine:** Inconsistent fuel delivery makes engine work harder

content.text: **Prevention saves money:** Fill up when light comes on (Â£60 tank) vs fuel pump replacement (Â£400+)
Prevention Tips

items: **Fill up at 1/4 tank** â€” Never let it go below quarter
**Long journey prep** â€” Fill up night before
**Know your range** â€” Check manual for tank size + MPG
**Fuel app** â€” Download PetrolPrices app, shows nearest stations + prices
**Motorway services** â€” Note which junctions have petrol stations before M6/M42 trips
**Keep Â£20 emergency cash** â€” In case card declined at pump
